titleStmt.title: The summe of two of the most principall pointes of this second part contained in this short prayer.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The summe of two of the most principall pointes of this second part contained in this short prayer.

monogr.title: The triall of trvth : containing a plaine and short discovery of the chiefest pointes of the doctrine of the great Antichrist, and of his adherentes the false teachers and heretikes of these last times
monogr.author: Terry, John

div.head: The summe of two of the most principall pointes of this second part contained in this short prayer.

p.hi: Conforme vs, O Lord, to thy wil: and then wil thou whatsoever thou wilt; giue vs a true tast of the sweetenes of thy loue in Christ: and then let all other thinges be either sweete or sowre vnto vs, as thou seest it to be best for vs in thine heavenly wisedome.
